availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Paine (Lyon County, Kentucky, master carpenter and manufacturer)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, master carpenter. North Carolina native. Married to Mary K. Cassidy Paine. Father of Thomas R. Paine, Eudora Paine, John E. Paine, Laura Paine, B. P. Paine, and Mary Paine. House carpenter in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Master Carpenter in Lyon County in 1860. Employed Samuel D. Paine as a carpenter apprentice in Lyon County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Lyon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 329A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 767.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 416A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 45A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994046, Lyon County Births.
"Thomas Power Paine (1822-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 68001064, accessed January 25, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68001064.
